title: Cone (topology)
summary: In topology, especially algebraic topology, the cone of a topological space X {\displaystyle X} is intuitively obtained by stretching X into a cylinder and then collapsing one of its end faces to a point. The cone of X is denoted by C X {\displaystyle CX} or by cone ‚Å° ( X ) {\displaystyle \operatorname {cone} (X)} .
